meta.title: WoT Oracle
meta.description: High-performance backend API for Nostr Web of Trust queries. Index the follow graph and query social distance at scale.

hero.title: WoT Oracle
hero.subtitle: High-performance indexer for the Nostr follow graph. Sub-millisecond queries answering "how many hops separate these two users?"

whatItDoes.title: What It Does
whatItDoes.description: WoT Oracle continuously syncs follow lists (Kind 3 events) from Nostr relays, building an in-memory graph of the entire social network. It then provides a REST API to query social distance between any two pubkeys.
whatItDoes.exampleText: If Alice follows Bob, and Bob follows Carol, then the distance from Alice to Carol is 2 hops.

distance.title: GET /distance
distance.description: Query the social distance between two pubkeys.

batch.title: POST /distance/batch
batch.description: Query distances from one pubkey to multiple targets.

stats.title: GET /stats
stats.description: Get statistics about the indexed graph.

selfHosting.title: Self-Hosting
selfHosting.subtitle: Run your own WoT Oracle instance. Full control over your trust infrastructure.

graphStorage.title: Graph Storage
graphStorage.description: In-memory graph for fast traversal, backed by SQLite for persistence. Syncs continuously from configured Nostr relays.

pathfinding.title: Pathfinding
pathfinding.description: Bidirectional breadth-first search (BFS) from both endpoints simultaneously, meeting in the middle for O(b^(d/2)) complexity.

caching.title: Caching
caching.description: LRU cache with configurable size and TTL. Most queries hit cache for sub-millisecond response times.

rateLimiting.title: Rate Limiting
rateLimiting.description: Per-IP rate limiting protects the service from abuse. Configurable limits for different deployment scenarios.

publicInstance.title: Public Instance
publicInstance.subtitle: A public instance is available for development and testing:
publicInstance.rateLimit: Rate limited to 100 requests/minute per IP. For production use, consider self-hosting.

cta.title: Open Source
cta.subtitle: Written in Rust. MIT licensed. Self-host for your community or contribute improvements.
